observations.text: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for AI assistants like Cursor and Claude @Web
Provides a structured environment for enhanced reasoning, persistent memory, and responsible tool usage
Built on three core principles: Elegant Simplicity, Enhanced Reflection, and Persistent Context
Features include a Think Tool, Knowledge Graph, Task Management, Web Research Tools, Memory Tools
The knowledge graph provides persistent memory across different interactions and sessions
Tool call limits and content caching are implemented for performance optimization
Version 2.0.5 is available for installation via NPX or global installation
Core mechanism for enabling advanced AI reasoning
Provides a structured environment for systematic problem analysis
Includes self-reflection capability with customizable prompts
Can be enabled with selfReflect: true parameter
Promotes deeper analysis and higher-quality outputs
Supports sequential steps in reasoning process
Provides persistent memory across different interactions and sessions
Features timestamped observations for tracking
Uses intelligent entity matching to avoid redundant entries
Supports automatic linkage between related concepts
Allows filtering by time, tags, keywords via memory_query tool
Tools include upsert_entities, add_observations, create_relations, search_nodes, memory_query, and open_nodes
Current implementation separates tasks (tasks.jsonl) and knowledge graph (memory.jsonl)
Tasks are partially integrated with knowledge graph via entity creation and observations
Full integration would store tasks directly as entities in knowledge graph
Integration would require modifying TaskStorage to use KnowledgeGraph as backing store
Key benefits include single storage, consistent querying, and better relationship modeling
